snippet: The death toll is expected to rise in the Islamabad attack, which came while the Taliban, which denied any role in the blast, were in talks with the government.
abstract: Powerful explosion rips through crowded market in Islamabad, Pakistan, killing at least 22 people and suggesting that, after a long stretch of relative calm, city is back in the firing line of the country’s militants.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Declan Walsh from London.

lead_paragraph: The death toll is expected to rise in the Islamabad attack, which came while the Taliban, which denied any role in the blast, were in talks with the government.

headline.main: Deadly Blast at Fruit Market Shatters Calm in Pakistan’s Capital
headline.print_headline: Deadly Blast at Fruit Market Shatters Calm in Pakistan’s Capital
